content.title: Renal Artery Dissection
content.description: Separation of renal artery wall layers creating true and false lumens, potentially causing renal ischemia.

treatment.medical: Anticoagulation, BP control if renal perfusion maintained
treatment.surgical: Reconstruction for failed endovascular or complex anatomy

content.clinical_pearl: FMD is common underlying cause; always evaluate for multivessel FMD if spontaneous renal dissection
content.statement: Renal Artery Dissection is a fundamental concept in Health-Sciences Medicine Surgery Vascular Pathology Renal-Artery that provides essential knowledge for understanding related topics and clinical/practical applications.

explanation.intuition: Understanding Renal Artery Dissection helps build foundational knowledge. The concept connects to broader principles in the field.
explanation.key_insight: The key aspects of Renal Artery Dissection include core principles, common applications, and integration with related concepts.
explanation.technical_details: Technical details involve specific mechanisms, measurements, and evidence-based applications of Renal Artery Dissection.
